perturbation.original_text: Distributor shall comply, and shall ensure that each Third Party Distributor complies, with the Guidelines for Applications set out in Exhibit C.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor shall endeavor to comply, and shall encourage each Third Party Distributor to comply, with the Guidelines for Applications set out in Exhibit C.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall comply' to 'shall endeavor to comply' and 'shall ensure' to 'shall encourage' introduces ambiguity and weakens the binding nature of the obligation. This makes compliance with the Guidelines for Applications (Exhibit C) discretionary rather than mandatory.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Deceptive Practices under the FTC Act
perturbation.law_citation: 15 U.S. Code § 45 - Unfair methods of competition unlawful; prevention by Commission
perturbation.law_explanation: Exhibit C contains guidelines designed to prevent deceptive, malicious, and annoying practices. By only 'endeavoring to comply' and 'encouraging' third parties, the distributor fails to ensure these practices are avoided. This contradicts the spirit and potentially the letter of the FTC Act, which prohibits unfair or deceptive acts or practices in commerce.

perturbation.original_text: In connection with Distributor's distribution of the Products under this Agreement, and before the Google Toolbar or Chrome Browser can be installed by an End User, Distributor shall provide each End User with: (a) a clear statement inviting the End User to agree to the terms of the applicable EULA; (b) the opportunity for each End User to review such EULA via a hyperlink to such EULA: and (c) a button on which each End User may click indicating agreement to the terms of such EULA.
perturbation.changed_text: In connection with Distributor's distribution of the Products under this Agreement, and before the Google Toolbar or Chrome Browser is installed by an End User, Distributor should attempt to provide each End User with: (a) a statement inviting the End User to agree to the terms of the applicable EULA; (b) an opportunity for each End User to potentially review such EULA via a hyperlink; and (c) a mechanism through which End Users might indicate some form of assent to the EULA.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall provide' with 'should attempt to provide,' 'a clear statement' with 'a statement,' 'the opportunity' with 'an opportunity,' and 'a button' with 'a mechanism' introduces ambiguity and weakens the requirements for obtaining informed consent before installing the software. It makes the process less definitive, creating uncertainty around whether the EULA terms are being properly presented and agreed to.
perturbation.law_explanation: CalOPPA requires websites and online services to conspicuously post a privacy policy. By weakening the requirement to present a clear statement, opportunity to review, and a mechanism for agreement of the EULA, it makes it less likely that users are actually presented with and agree to the terms, including privacy policies, thus potentially violating CalOPPA's implied requirement for affirmative consent for data collection.

perturbation.original_text: During the Term, Distributor shall, on a [ * ] basis, no later than the [ * ] of the following [ * ], provide Google with a report identifying, on a country-by-country basis, the total number of: (i) Bundles distributed; (ii) Installs Completed; (iii) Google Toolbar offers presented to End Users; and (iv) Chrome Browser offers presented to End Users, in the preceding [ * ].
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term, Distributor will, when feasible, attempt to provide Google with a report, potentially identifying the approximate number of: (i) Bundles distributed; (ii) Installs Completed; (iii) Google Toolbar offers presented to End Users; and (iv) Chrome Browser offers presented to End Users.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Distributor shall' to 'Distributor will, when feasible, attempt to provide', 'on a [ * ] basis, no later than the [ * ] of the following [ * ], provide Google with a report identifying, on a country-by-country basis, the total number of:' to 'potentially identifying the approximate number of', introduces significant ambiguity. This modification makes the reporting obligation discretionary and the accuracy of the report uncertain, undermining Google's ability to track distribution and revenue.
perturbation.law_citation: 17 CFR § 210.4-01(a)(1) - Form and content of financial statements
perturbation.law_explanation: These regulations require that financial statements, and therefore revenue recognition, be based on reliable and verifiable data. By making the reporting of key metrics (Bundles distributed, Installs Completed, etc.) discretionary and approximate, the modified text hinders Google's ability to accurately track its revenue share and comply with SEC regulations regarding revenue recognition, as the reported data is no longer precise or consistently provided.
